unnormalised: Okay, here's a Quora post about Exam Prep Apps in the Education Technology category, with all the requested elements:
normalised: Exam Prep Apps: Yay or Nay? What's worked for you?

unnormalised: **Exam Prep Apps: Yay or Nay? What's worked for you?**
normalised: Hey everyone! So, exams are looming, and like every other student in India, I'm frantically trying to figure out how to ace them. This time around, I'm seriously considering using an exam prep app. Back in my day (said like a proper aunty, ha ha!), we just had bulky textbooks and maybe some handwritten notes from Rohan. Things have definitely changed!

unnormalised: Hey everyone! So, exams are looming, and like every other student in India, I'm frantically trying to figure out how to ace them. normalised: I'm prepping for my engineering entrance, the J E E, and the sheer volume of information is overwhelming. Has anyone here used apps like B Y J U apostrophe S, Vedantu, or Unacademy for J E E prep, or even just for general exam readiness? Did they actually help you improve your score? I'm looking for something that's more interactive than just reading, you know? Maybe practice tests with detailed solutions and some personalized learning paths.

unnormalised: I'm prepping for my engineering entrance, the JEE, and the sheer volume of information is overwhelming. Has anyone here used apps like BYJU'S, Vedantu, or Unacademy for JEE prep, or even just for general exam readiness? Did they actually help you improve your score? I'm looking for something that's more interactive than just reading, you know? Maybe practice tests with detailed solutions and some personalized learning paths.
normalised: Specifically, I'm worried about time management. The J E E is a beast! I need to be able to solve problems quickly and accurately. Do these apps have good mock tests that simulate the actual exam environment? I’m aiming to start a rigorous schedule on tenth October two thousand and twenty four, waking up at zero five hundred hours everyday for study. Also, are they worth the subscription fees? Some of them cost a small fortune, feels like more than my entire pocket money (rupees five thousand per month!)

unnormalised: Specifically, I'm worried about time management. The JEE is a beast! I need to be able to solve problems quickly and accurately. Do these apps have good mock tests that simulate the actual exam environment? I’m aiming to start a rigorous schedule on 10/10/2024, waking up at 05:00 hrs everyday for study. Also, are they worth the subscription fees? Some of them cost a small fortune, feels like more than my entire pocket money (Rs. 5000/month!)
normalised: Any recommendations, tips, or horror stories (to scare me straight) would be greatly appreciated! I’m hoping to crack this exam and join I I T Delhi. I will devote myself at least six hours per day until the exams in May two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: Any recommendations, tips, or horror stories (to scare me straight) would be greatly appreciated! I’m hoping to crack this exam and join IIT Delhi. I will devote myself at least 6 hrs/day until the exams in May 2025.
